Welcome to REST API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact information to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object that is created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_birthdays function takes in a skip, limit, user and db as parameters. It then creates an empty list called contacts_with_birthdays. It also gets the current date and year from the datetime module. Then it queries all of the contacts that belong to a specific user with an offset and limit (for pagination). For each contact in those queried contacts, it checks if their birthday is within 7 days of today’s date by subtracting today’s date from their birthday for this year (current_year) using timedelta(). If so, they are added to the list created earlier called contacts_with_

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function takes in a contact_id and user, and returns the first contact that matches the given id. If no such contact exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Find the contact in the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to access the contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact if it exists, otherwise none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function is used to retrieve contacts from the database. It takes in a skip, limit, first_name, last_name and email as parameters. The skip parameter is used to determine how many records should be skipped before returning results. The limit parameter determines how many records should be returned after skipping the specified number of records (skip). If no value for either of these parameters are provided then all contacts will be returned by default. The first_name and last_name parameters are optional string values that can be passed in order to filter out any contact whose name does not match the specified value(s).

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the amount of contacts returned

  • first_name – str: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter contacts by email

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the Contact object. This is a Pydantic model, so it will be validated before being passed into this function. See models/contact_model for more details on what fields are required and how they are validated by Pydantic’s validation engine.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact model to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is logged in and has access to the contact

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes an email and a database session as arguments. It then queries the database for the user with that email address, sets their confirmed field to True, and commits those changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user that is being confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function takes a UserModel object and a database session as arguments. It then creates an avatar for the user using Gravatar, which is an online service that allows users to create avatars based on their email address. If there is no avatar available for the given email address, it will return None instead of raising an exception. The function then creates a new user with all of the information from body (the UserModel object) and adds it to our database session.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A new user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session)¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session. It then queries the User table for a user with that email address. If it finds one, it returns the first result of that query.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email address of the user to be retrieved from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function takes an email and a url as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to retrieve the user from the database. The avatar attribute of that user is set to be equal to the url argument, and then the db session is committed so that it can be saved in our database.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session)¶

The update_token function updates the user’s refresh token in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • token – str | None: Set the refresh token for a user

  • db – Session: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent
